law.text: Kentucky hereby obligates itself for the replacement, within a reasonable time, of any moneys received pursuant to Title III of the Social Security Act which, because of any action or contingency, are lost or expended for purposes other than, or in amounts in excess of, those found necessary by the appropriate federal agency for the proper administration of this chapter.
law.history: Amended 1950 Ky. Acts ch. 206, sec. 1. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4748g-25.
